issueTitle: Loose cabinet hinge causing door sag
highLevelOverview: Tighten hinge screws and inspect for stripped holes
Replace hinge or add wood filler if the screws won't hold
Realign the door to restore even gaps

parts.name: Cabinet hinge
parts.notes: Match the cup diameter and overlay style.

parts.name: #6 wood screws
parts.notes: Longer screws help if holes are stripped.

steps.title: Inspect the hinge
steps.detail: Open the door and check if the hinge plate is loose or bent.

steps.title: Tighten screws
steps.detail: Tighten all hinge screws and test the door alignment.

steps.title: Check screw holes
steps.detail: If screws spin freely, remove them and inspect the holes.

steps.title: Reinforce holes
steps.detail: Add wood filler or toothpicks with glue, then let dry.

steps.title: Re-drill pilot holes
steps.detail: Drill a small pilot hole to prevent splitting.

steps.title: Reinstall hinge
steps.detail: Reattach the hinge using longer screws if needed.

steps.title: Adjust alignment
steps.detail: Use the hinge adjustment screws to align the door gaps.

steps.title: Final check
steps.detail: Open and close the door to confirm smooth movement.

safetyChecklist: Keep fingers clear of hinge pinch points
commonMistakes: Overtightening and stripping the hinge screws
Replacing the hinge without matching the overlay style
verifyBeforeBuy: Check overlay type to match the existing door

highLevelOverview: Shut off water and remove handle

parts.name: Faucet cartridge
parts.notes: Match the faucet brand and model.

parts.name: O-ring set
parts.notes: Bring the old O-ring to match size.

steps.title: Turn off water
steps.detail: Shut off the hot and cold supply valves.

steps.title: Remove handle
steps.detail: Locate the set screw and remove the handle.

steps.title: Inspect cartridge
steps.detail: Check the cartridge for wear or cracks.

steps.title: Remove cartridge
steps.detail: Use pliers to pull the cartridge straight out.

steps.title: Replace seals
steps.detail: Swap O-rings and lubricate lightly.

steps.title: Install new cartridge
steps.detail: Seat the cartridge and align tabs.

steps.title: Reassemble handle
steps.detail: Reattach the handle and tighten the set screw.

steps.title: Test
steps.detail: Turn water back on and check for leaks.

safetyChecklist: Cover the drain to avoid losing parts
commonMistakes: Forcing the cartridge out and damaging the housing
verifyBeforeBuy: Match cartridge stem length and spline count

issueTitle: Drawer sticking and not closing fully
highLevelOverview: Check slides for debris or misalignment

parts.name: Drawer slide set
parts.notes: Match the slide length to the drawer depth.

steps.title: Remove drawer
steps.detail: Release the slide clips and pull the drawer out.

steps.title: Inspect slides
steps.detail: Look for debris or bent rails.

steps.title: Clean rails
steps.detail: Wipe down slides and remove debris.

steps.title: Check mounting screws
steps.detail: Tighten any loose mounting screws.

steps.title: Realign slides
steps.detail: Use a level to ensure slides are parallel.

steps.title: Lubricate
steps.detail: Apply a light lubricant to the slide rails.

steps.title: Reinstall drawer
steps.detail: Align and slide the drawer back in.

steps.title: Test operation
steps.detail: Open and close fully to confirm smooth action.

safetyChecklist: Support the drawer to avoid drops
Keep hands clear of pinch points
verifyBeforeBuy: Measure drawer depth for slide length
